page.title: 12Hill Farmer's Wife: FINTRY
page.content:
Sheep farming is intensive here, so the farmer's wife helps by{answering {the phone, dealing with salesmen and {directing deliveries.}From spring to autumn the day starts early and ends late.{Meals times are irregular and {she must feed helpers at lambing-time, {dipping, clipping and the gathering {for sale-time.}She ferries the children and probably does B&B.
The farm house will have electricity, running water from its own spring and septic tanks for sewage. Domestic help is almost non-existant, so labour saving machines are vital, especially the freezer, for food is usually bulk bought as few vans call now.
The wife{may also be called on to work {in the fank (covered sheep pen), help {move stock and with orphaned lambs.
